page.title: 01HISTORICAL NAILSWORTH
page.content: {Nailsworth }is a small town in the {Cotswolds.}Its original name was { {"NEGLELEAG".}It is derived from Negle ("The weight of wood") and Leag ("a pasture").This later changed to wert ("a market place")thus becoming { {Negleswert}("a wool market or wool place"). {Nailsworth }has several old water mills.There is a new working wheel in {Ruskin Mill. Days Mill }nowadays exhibits Cotswold crafts.{Egypt Mill} was a flour mill and still features an attractive weir. {Nailsworth's }other interesting features are the {Copper Kettle, } which hangs in George Street, said to hold 82 gallons.It was originally outside an iron mongers in Malmesbury. There is also a clock tower, an old fountain and several historic houses.
